ntnu.stud.valens.stepdetector

Class DetectStepsThread

  • java.lang.Object
    • ntnu.stud.valens.stepdetector.DetectStepsThread
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable

    public class DetectStepsThread
extends Object
implements Runnable
    A separate thread called by StepMainService to calculate the step time stamps based on a time series of data. Performed in a separate thread to not interfere with the sensor input in StepMainService.
    Author:
    Elias

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      DetectStepsThread(List<Float> mTimeSeries, List<Long> mTimeStamps, StepMainService activity, double mean, double std)
      Constructs the new thread for calculating peaks

    • Constructor Detail

      • DetectStepsThread

        public DetectStepsThread(List<Float> mTimeSeries,
                 List<Long> mTimeStamps,
                 StepMainService activity,
                 double mean,
                 double std)
        Constructs the new thread for calculating peaks
        Parameters:
        mTimeSeries - - The time series of data
        mTimeStamps - - The time stamps associated with the time series of data
        activity - - The SetpMainService activity that called the thread

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Performs the running of the thread. Calculation follows the given steps: 1) Smoothing the time series data 2) Give each point a peak strength depending on the neighbouring data 3) Find prospective peaks 4) Remove peaks that are too close to constituate individual peaks For a detailed description of the algorithm, see the documentation.
        Specified by:
        run in interface Runnable

      • pushToContentProvider

        public void pushToContentProvider(Long step)
        Connects to the content provider to store the time stamp of a single step.
        Parameters:
        Step - - The time stamp of the single step.
